intro: Pedicularis sylvatica f. glabrescens, commonly known as the glabrous lady's smock, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems and clusters of bright yellow flowers. The plant is distinguished by its glabrous (smooth) appearance, lacking the typical pubescence found in the species. It thrives in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and meadows. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological and horticultural interest.
